testId.name: Asynchronous Batch Response - Synchronous Iterator MEPs

testCase.response: Get the list of existing TransmissionDescriptor names. This operation may only be directed to a top-level OS and not to a subordinate OS. Note that the response message is handled by getObjectNamesResponse_T.
Get the list of existing TransmissionDescriptors and their associated distinguishing information. This operation may only be directed to a top-level OS and not to a subordinate OS.

testCase.bodyParameters: tmdName: the name of the Transmission Descriptor
testCase.response: This operation allows an OS to request all of the TPs associated with the specified Transmission Descriptor. If there are no TPs which are associated with the specified Transmission Descriptor, then an empty list is returned.

tests.exceptions:
EXCPT_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
EXCPT_INTERNAL_ERROR
EXCPT_INVALID_INPUT
EXCPT_ENTITY_NOT_FOUND
EXCPT_COMM_FAILURE
Note: Those exceptions are common to all operations.The conditions when they are raised are specific to each operation (Refer to the TMF 854 XML Solution Set document for details).

postconditions.success: The requesting OS has all the requested inventory information from the target OS.
postconditions.failure: The requesting OS does not have the entire requested inventory information from the target OS.

tests.comments:
CommunicationPattern = MultipleBatchResponse
CommunicationStyle = RPC or MSG
